page.title: 09LOCAL TRAVEL
page.content: How the children travel to school. 200 children were asked how they came to school. The results show how important cars are in many families especially as this school is in a very rural area.The results were as follows:cars 57%;minibus 23%; walk 9%, public bus 6%;bicycle 5%. How far dads travel to work. 100 children were asked how far their dad usually travelled to work on a normal day. We discovered the following: 18% worked locally; 23% travelled up to 10 miles away; 28% travelled between 10 and 20 miles;9% travelled more than twenty miles;11% travelled to London;3% travelled to Brighton and the Coast;6% to Eastbourne;2% did not work.
